intro: Acilepis pulneyensis, commonly known as the pulney's acilepis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
